result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward J Dawson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft by Contractor <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Edward J Dawson in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
The State's victim is not here and she indicates that there was a misunderstanding with victim witness as to what would happen today. 
State calls DOC agent Karen Sharp - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #1, 2 & 3; moves same into evidence/received. Defense marks Ex #4
Ms. Sharp indicates she will email this Courts clerk with the names of persons that the Court can contact to attempt to resolve the issues.

BTC: 
State amends Ct 1 to Misd theft by contractor based on the restitution being paid.

Restitution hearing on June 18, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 18, 2018 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Edward J Dawson in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reporter: Brady Bish.
The State files amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt/waives reading of same. Upon pl to amended count, the State recommends RCJ=CFTS and a fine. Restitution has been paid in Ozaukee County but the victim has not been paid from Ozaukee County. The DOC agent has admitted to Ms. Rich that the restitution Mr. Dawson paid was paid out to the wrong victim.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950.
P-NC
COP filed, rights given 

BTC: Matter needs to be set over to give the State time to get a printout of where this money actually went.  Restitution hearing scheduled for June 18, 2018 at 02:30 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2018 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 4, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Edward J Dawson in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
The State indicates this matter may be set for COP/SEH as it appears the deft has paid such significant amounts for restitution she believes restitution is paid  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on February 27, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward J Dawson in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
Defense has received receipt for money orders and those have been provided to counsel. The State agrees to adj the matter for another 30 days  Status conference scheduled for February 27, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on January 30, 2018 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Edward J Dawson in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
The State spoke with deft's agent yesterday and the deft's agent indicates none of the restitution to the Ozaukee Co victim has not been paid. Defense indicates that deft has made the restitution payment and that it hasn't been processed through Madison yet and the information reached the agent. Defense asks for one more adj to figure out the issue. There is an agreement that is contingent upon restitution being paid on this case but ordered by an Ozaukee County Judge to be paid there. The money order was made out to DOC, $5,218.00.00 that was mailed on December 6 to his probation agent in Waukesha.  Status conference scheduled for January 30, 2018 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on December 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory Reed in court.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
Defense indicates there was a misunderstanding regarding the date. Defense also indicates that the deft has most of the $$ paid. The victim has not received any of the money Ozaukee County says they have. Parties ask for another STC to figure out what's going on. There is a stipulation between parties that deft will pay the restitution that the State has requested.  Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.
